withdraw.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this
withdraw.translation[0].definitions[0].e: A knee injury forced her to withdraw from the competition.
calls for Britain to withdraw from the European Union
Parents have the right to withdraw their children from religious education lessons if they wish.
withdraw.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to stop giving support or money to someone or something, especially as the result of an official decision
withdraw.translation[0].definitions[1].e: One of the minority parties had withdrawn its support for Chancellor Kohl.
Union members will vote on whether to withdraw their labour (=stop working).
a government decision to withdraw funding
withdraw.translation[0].definitions[2].d: if you withdraw a threat, offer, request etc, you say that you no longer will do what you said
withdraw.translation[0].definitions[2].e: After much persuasion he agreed to withdraw his resignation.
withdraw.translation[0].definitions[3].d: if you withdraw a remark, criticism, statement etc, you say that what you said earlier was completely untrue
withdraw.translation[0].definitions[3].e: He refused to withdraw his remarks and was expelled from the Party.
The newspaper has agreed to withdraw its allegations.
withdraw.translation[0].definitions[4].d: if a product or service is withdrawn, it is no longer offered for sale or use
withdraw.translation[0].definitions[4].e: The drug has been withdrawn from the market for further tests.
withdraw something from sale/from the market
withdraw.translation[0].definitions[5].d: if an army withdraws, or if it is withdrawn, it leaves a place
withdraw.translation[0].definitions[5].e: the USA’s decision to withdraw 40,000 troops from western Europe
withdraw.translation[0].definitions[6].d: to leave a place, especially in order to be alone or go somewhere quiet
withdraw.translation[0].definitions[6].e: We withdrew to the garden for a private talk.
withdraw.translation[0].definitions[7].d: to take money out of a bank account
withdraw.translation[0].definitions[7].e: I’d like to withdraw £500 from my current account.
withdraw.translation[0].definitions[7].n: In everyday English, people often say that someone takes or gets money out rather than withdraws it:
Can we stop off at the bank? I need to get some money out.
withdraw.translation[0].definitions[8].d: if you withdraw your hand, arm, finger etc from somewhere, you move it from there to where it was before
withdraw.translation[0].definitions[8].e: Claudia withdrew her hand from his.
withdraw.translation[0].definitions[9].d: to take an object out from inside something
withdraw.translation[0].definitions[9].e: She withdrew a document from her briefcase.
to become quieter, less friendly, and only concerned about your own thoughts
Many depressed people just withdraw into themselves.
Ralph has withdrawn from the other kids.
withdraw.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to take money out of a bank account
withdraw.translation[1].definitions[0].e: You can withdraw cash from ATMs in any town or city.
withdraw.translation[1].definitions[1].d: to remove something or take it back, often because of an official decision
withdraw.translation[1].definitions[1].e: a government decision to withdraw funding
They offered her the job but then withdrew the offer after checking her references.
withdraw.translation[1].definitions[2].d: if a company withdraws a product or service, it stops making it available, either for a period of time or permanently
withdraw.translation[1].definitions[2].e: Previous testing showed no safety problems, but the company decided to withdraw the product so the incidents could be investigated.
The drug has been withdrawn from the market for further testing.
withdraw.translation[1].definitions[3].d: to say that something you said earlier was completely untrue
withdraw.translation[1].definitions[3].e: The newspaper has agreed to withdraw its allegations.
withdraw.translation[1].definitions[4].d: to no longer take part in something or to no longer belong to a particular organization
withdraw.translation[1].definitions[4].e: The Bank of New York withdrew as a primary dealer of U.S. government securities.
His decision to withdraw from active management was a blow to the company.
